title: Our Declaration - shift to past tense

content.question: The shift to the past tense in the sentence in lines 51-53 (“But it . . . from Britain”) occurs because this sentence refers to

choices.label: an idea about the Declaration that is no longer current
the rhetoric used in the Declaration to explain its intent
a political change that had occurred prior to the Declaration
the role of the Declaration at the time of its writing

content.answer: the role of the Declaration at the time of its writing

skill.text: Skill 7.C: Explain how grammar and mechanics contribute to the clarity and effectiveness of an argument.
